School Social Worker Week -

A BIG Thanks for all you do for kids! School social workers are a vital link in the school community. You not only counsel children, but staff as well.

You bring students, teachers and parents together to work towards understanding and success. You calm the disruptive child so the teacher can get back to educating, and you help kids prevent and resolve conflicts making the building a better place.

You are a voice for those kids and families who can't find the courage or words to express their needs. You connect parents with resources, and in some cases, coordinate educational and outside care to help families be less overwhelmed. And for some situations, you find resources for physical needs such as food and housing.

You support the school and the people in it- helping kids and teachers be "ready to learn" every day.

We are happy to have Toni Mathews on our team at PAS!
#SchoolSocialWorkerWeek

Parent-Teacher Conferences on Thursday, February 27

Parent-Teacher Conferences Reminder to all students and parents that Parent-Teacher Conferences are scheduled for Thursday, February 27th from 4-8 pm. You are invited to attend and visit with your teacher to get updates on how students are meeting the academic standards in their classes. 8th Grade Registration Parents of current 8th grade students are invited to attend a registration meeting at 6:30pm on Thursday, February 27th in the auditorium. This is our second meeting so if you couldn't attend the meeting last week, please attend this week. You will learn about course options for next school year and complete the registration process as your student transitions into high school. Activity Registration If you are coming for conferences you can also register your students for Spring activities from 4:30 - 7:00pm.

Valentines Day Etiquette for MS/HS

We encourage all the support and kindness communicated to our students and staff over Valentine‚Äôs Day. We want our students to be able to participate in the experience while still receiving as little disrupted instructional time as possible. Pipestone Area Schools in cooperation with local florists and other merchants follow the following guidelines.

*Personal items from parents, other family members, or friends must be brought in by 1:30pm Friday, February 14. We cannot accept responsibilities for deliveries made after this time. Individual notes will not be sent out

*All businesses will have a labeled table in the commons with deliverable items.

*A Final list of student recipients will be sent out 1 time to staff.

*Students whose name appears on the list will be dismissed at 3:10 to pick up their items from the commons.

Thank you for your understanding and have a great Valentines Day!
